intro: Cheirostylis kabaenae, commonly known as the Kabaena orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Kabaena in Indonesia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers with a unique coloration pattern, typically featuring a combination of white and purple hues. Its botanical features include long, slender pseudobulbs and narrow,革质 (leathery) leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
